region.title: First Impressions
region.observation: This feels like looking into a dark, mysterious space - maybe an old building or underground room with warm light coming through
region.why_notable: Your first gut feeling about what you're seeing is important and valid
region.soft_prompt: What does this space remind you of? A basement, an old building, somewhere else?

steps.why_this_sequence: Starting with overall emotional response helps Stage 1 viewers connect personally

region.title: The Ghostly Figures
region.observation: See those pale, almost transparent figures in the center? They look like people moving through this dark space
region.why_notable: These mysterious figures make the scene feel alive and a bit spooky
region.soft_prompt: What do you think these pale figures are doing? Are they walking, working, or something else?

steps.why_this_sequence: After establishing the setting, focus on the human elements that create story
steps.builds_on: Now that you've felt the mysterious atmosphere, let's see who's inside this space

region.title: Windows to the Outside
region.observation: Those bright white rectangles on the left look like windows letting in daylight from outside
region.why_notable: The contrast between dark inside and bright outside makes this feel real and familiar
region.soft_prompt: How does seeing those bright windows change how the dark space feels to you?

steps.why_this_sequence: Light/dark contrast helps them understand the space and adds emotional depth
steps.builds_on: The windows help explain why some areas are darker and others have that warm glow

region.title: The Warm Orange Glow
region.observation: Notice how orange and golden colors seem to float and glow throughout the scene, especially around the figures
region.why_notable: This warm light makes the mysterious space feel less scary and more magical
region.soft_prompt: How do these warm colors make you feel about what's happening here?

steps.why_this_sequence: Ending with color/mood helps synthesize their emotional journey through the piece
steps.builds_on: The warm colors tie together the mysterious figures, the dark space, and the outside light into one feeling

welcome_text: Let's explore this mysterious scene together. Take your time and trust what you see and feel - there's no right or wrong way to experience this artwork.

final_summary.main_takeaway: You've discovered a scene that feels both mysterious and familiar - like looking into a secret world where everyday life happens in magical light
final_summary.connections: The bright windows, ghostly figures, dark space, and warm glowing colors all work together to create a feeling that's both spooky and comforting
final_summary.invitation_to_return: Next time you look, you might notice even more details hiding in those shadows and glowing areas
final_summary.reflection_question: What story do you think is happening in this mysterious glowing space?

pedagogical_approach: Emotional entry point leading to concrete observations, building personal narrative connections through accessible visual elements

reflection_activities.title: Your Memory Connection
reflection_activities.prompt: This glowing, mysterious scene might remind you of a place or moment from your own life. What does it make you think of? Maybe a cozy room at night, or somewhere that felt magical to you?
reflection_activities.placeholder: It reminds me of my grandmother's kitchen at night...
reflection_activities.why_this_activity: Assesses ability to make personal connections and express emotional responses to visual elements

reflection_activities.title: The Story Inside
reflection_activities.prompt: You noticed this feels like looking into a secret world. If you could step inside this glowing space, what do you think you would find happening there? What's the story?
reflection_activities.placeholder: I think there might be people having dinner by candlelight...
reflection_activities.why_this_activity: Reveals storytelling ability and willingness to interpret visual clues imaginatively

reflection_activities.title: Feelings and Colors
reflection_activities.prompt: You found this scene both spooky and comforting at the same time. How do you think the artist used light and dark colors to create those mixed feelings?
reflection_activities.placeholder: The warm yellow light makes it cozy, but the dark shadows...
reflection_activities.why_this_activity: Tests emerging awareness of how artistic elements create emotional effects

responses.activity_activity_1: This is a steel mill scene from Pittsburgh, PA
responses.activity_activity_2: These are guys working very hard under tough conditions
responses.activity_activity_3: Yellows/oranges give warm feelings whereas they contrast with the dark interior.  The white figures stand out even more in the dark room.

assessment.feedback: You're doing well at your current level. Keep practicing and challenging yourself with new observations.
